subject: Economics
subcategory: Economic Crises That Shook the World
title: The Mexican Peso Crisis: The Tequila Effect
description: A quick win: understand The Mexican Peso Crisis: The Tequila Effect.

hook.text: In December 1994, Mexico devalued the peso by 50% in one week.

buildup.text: Mexico had pegged the peso to the dollar while running large deficits. Foreign money poured in, masking fragility.

discovery.text: When confidence broke, investors pulled $20 billion in weeks. The US organized a $50 billion emergency rescue.

twist.text: The crisis spread to Brazil and Argentina â€” the Tequila Effect. Markets learned emerging economies were linked.

climax.text: Mexico repaid the rescue early and reformed. The crisis proved that fixed exchange rates invite speculative attacks.

punchline.text: Peg your currency, and you peg your fate to confidence.

quiz.question: What is the 'Tequila Effect'?
options: Mexico's crisis spread to other Latin American economies
Alcohol consumption rose during the crisis
